title: Spermatophyte
summary: The spermatophytes (lit. 'seed-bearing plants'; from Ancient Greek  σπέρματος (spérmatos) 'seed', and  φυτόν (phutón) 'plant'), also known as phanerogams (taxon Phanerogamae) or phaenogams (taxon Phaenogamae), comprise those plants that produce seeds, hence the alternative name seed plants. They are a subset of the embryophytes or land plants.
